result.execSummary:
The defendant Jakeb J Kirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Rusk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
No abusive contact with ES.

DE will comply with all receommendatons of DOC agent.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge, and pay the DOM assessment.

DE will have credit of 53 days served if revoked.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

NOH
Review hearing on August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Review hearing on August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:27 AM Defendant Jakeb J Kirk in court.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Jakeb J Kirk.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CM1-Parties do not dispute of revocation packet.  The State is in agreement with the recommendations from the revocation packet which is for 9 months jail.  Atty Osberg requests a 6 month jail sentence, DE does have employment when released.  DE has credit for 122 days. DE addresses the court, has been attending AODA meetings while incarcerated, does plan to attend AA when released.  The court will order 7 month jail. CV Judgment for unpaid court obligations, DE will pay the DOM assessment if not already assessed. 

22CM93-will be rescheduled.  Bond will be amended to no abusive contact with MAK, no discussion of the case. Set for RH August 16, 2022 @ 2:00
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
DE is undecided about seeking PCR
Case settlement

03:04 PM Defendant Jakeb J Kirk in court with attorney Katherine Cook.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Cook recites agreement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea to Ct 1, Ct 2 will be DRI.  Recommended sentence will be for withheld sentence,  one year probation.  No abusive contact with ES, DE will pay Court Costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge, pay DOM assessment,  comply with all recommendations from DOC agent.  53 days credit if revoked.  

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily made, court accepts plea of NC, finds DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommended sentence. Adj 3:13pm.

01:34 PM Defendant Jakeb J Kirk in court with attorney Katherine Cook.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Cook the bond was amended yesterday per stipulation, however parties have an agreement.  Set for Plea/Sentencing at 3:00pm today. Adj 1:37pm.
DE must be employed.
Stipulation to Modify Bond
Bail/bond hearing on February 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: DE must be employed.  When job is verified at Besse Lumber DE may be released from custody
Review hearing on April 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

02:00 PM Defendant Jakeb J Kirk in court with attorney Katherine Cook.  Defendant Jakeb J Kirk in custody.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jakeb J Kirk appeared by video means with Attorney.   Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  Atty would like to address bond, would like cash bond converted to a sign bond.  DE states he has a job as an operator at Besse Lumber if he can get huber.  State does not object to sign bond with condition that if DE becomes unemployed he must return to jail.  Atty Cook objects, wishes to have a sign bond w/o that condition.  $1000.00 sign bond, DE must be employed, When job is verifed with Besse Lumber DE may be released.  Set for RH April 12, 2022 @ 3:30PM. Adj 2:07pm.
21GF252 into 21CM1
Hearing on January 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
2:32pm DE appears from RC Jail, PD Raymond appears with DE. ADA Nelson appears for the State. No CC filed as of yet, set for Init App January 4, 2022 @ 1:00PM. Adj 2:33PM

Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5). No contact with ES with the exception of incidential contact with regards to the child.  DE must reside with his parents.

2:47pm DE appears from RC jail.  PD Katherine Cook appears with DE.   State will be asking for some cash, no contact with ES or the residence. DE not to possess weapons.  Victim makes a statement to the court, asking that the no contact not be put in place.  Atty Cook asking the court for a sign bond, states the reasoning for this.  Court will order a $250.00 cash bond, DE will reside with her parents, no contact with ES with the exception of incidental contact concerning the child.  Set for Init App December 28, 2021 @ 1:00PM. Adj 2:54pm.
Hold for bond hearing.
